feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Extra licence for Scope Item 1RK?
entry.content:
Hello

We would like to use scope Item 1RK for our Public Cloud Customer. Does it require a extra licence? Thanks in advance, Melanie

entry.title: Quantity Distribution settings
entry.content:
Hello,

We use the quantity distribution as described in https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/quantity-distribution/ba-p/13685342 to distribute the receipt of goods, allowing them to be committed using the ATP check. However, we see that the configuration of this feature is not as we expect it to be. Currently, the quantity is distributed over the horizon that is between the planned start and the planned end. The slack that we build in between the scheduled start and the planned start is not taken into account in this. The desired situation is that the quantity is distributed between the scheduled start and the planned end, taking into account the GR Proc. Time.

Is there any Customizing that we can do to create the situation that we desire instead of the presented situation. We work in SAP s4 Hana cloud.

 

Looking forward to your answer!

 

Best regards,

Lars

entry.title: Automatic Payment Run Identification in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Each automatic payment run generates a unique identifier for the proposal. Is this code stored in the accounting document of the payment so that it allows tracking which invoices were cleared?

When reconciling the payment, I cannot find any identification that stores the batch of automatic payments to be able to search for it.

In other words, I would like to know if the system stores the batch number or any identifier in the accounting entries of automatic payments to facilitate the search and reconciliation of remittances with multiple invoices.

Does anyone know anything about this?

entry.title: Significant Performance Degradation in SAP BPA UI Automation Steps when Targeting SAP HANA Cloud UI
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing a sudden and severe slowdown in our SAP Build Process Automation bots that interact with our SAP HANA Cloud web interface. All UI-related activities (e.g., Click, Set Element, Get Element) are executing extremely slowly, taking 10-20 times longer than usual. However, non-UI automation activities within the same project (such as Excel operations, file system activities, and loops) are executing at normal speed. The issue is strictly confined to the interaction between the BPA agent and the target web application.

Please provide your suggestions and insights on this issue we are facing.

Thanks in advance

entry.title: SAP Screen Personas – Control Personas Button Visibility Based on RF Screen Field Value
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – EWM RF Environment and using SAP Screen Personas to enhance an RF screen.

I have added a custom Personas push button (Print HU) on an RF screen, but when i made the custom flavor default i could see this custom button on each screen of this application as below

The requirement is to show this button only when “GR Posted” = X on the same RF screen.
Screen details
• RF screen program: /SCWM/SAPL_RF_RECEIVING_HUS
• Screen: 0501
• Field GR Posted is a display-only text field, captured via recording as:
wnd[0]/usr/subx:/SCWM/SAPL_RF_RECEIVING_HUS:0501/txt/SCWM/S_RF_REHU_HU-PGR
• Custom Personas button technical ID (from recording):
wnd[0]/usr/btnPersonas_XXXXXXXXXXXX

What I tried
In the onLoad Personas script, I am reading the value of the GR Posted text field and toggling the button visibility

My questions
1. Is this the correct and supported approach in Screen Personas to control visibility of a Personas button based on a display-only RF field?
2. Is there a recommended best practice to Custom button visibility/ Custom persona flavor applicability based on existing screen field values
3. Any limitations or risks in S/4HANA Public Cloud RF environments I should be aware of when using this approach?

System Information
• SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
• EWM RF Environment
• SAP Screen Personas (Flavor & Scripts)

Thanks in advance.

Phani Deepthi A

entry.content:

Proxy error GENERAL_ERROR Error duing proxy processing (PART U: NKNOWN (NULL) )
Execution failed; see further messages for details

Regards

Janarthanan

entry.title: How to view bank details changes for multiple vendors
entry.content:
Hi all,

For audit purposes, we would like to be able to generate a report that shows the details of changes made to vendor bank details - including the old and new values. The report "Display Changes to Vendors" just shows any bank account changes as separate "deleted" and "created" lines rather than showing the old and new values. The change history from Maintain Business Partner > Menu > Extras > Change History gives us the information we need but we would like to be able to extract this for multiple vendors at once. Is there any way to do this? We are using S4Hana Cloud Public.

Thanks

entry.title: How should the code be formatted when WS-Addressing is enabled in SoapUI for the Clearing API?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with a SAP Clearing API in SoapUI. As this is an Asynchronous API, it is compulsory to check "Enable/Disable WS-A addressing" in the settings, as mentioned in this Blog: Guidelines for Testing Journal Entry API with SOAP... - SAP Community

Could someone please advise or share an example of what the code should look like when WS-Addressing is enabled? Are there specific headers or elements that need to be added to comply with the API requirements?

Any insights, examples, or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks a lot.

get weekday?

Thanks&Regards.

entry.title: Batch Valuation Activation At Material Level
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are currently using SAP S4 HANA public cloud 2058, and we
are trying to activate batch valuation for HALB & FERT(Standard) material type, for
which it is not working in the public cloud. So we decided to copy the existing
material type and create a Z material type, for eg, ZHALB, and activate batch valuation,
for which it is working fine. Is it a recommended approach to proceed with the Z
material type, with batch valuation being active in SAP S4 HANA public cloud
2508.
Thanks for the support!!

entry.title: Principal propagation from SAP Digital Manufacturing Production Process towards S/4HANA public cloud
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I am working on a requirement that needs a custom production process in SAP Digital Manufacturing calling an SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Cloud OData api. I have followed the steps as mentioned in this blog post external-api-web-service-integration-with-sap-digital-manufacturing .

Here is my BTP destination in the subaccount where DM is subscribed.

tokenServiceURLType=Dedicated
audience=https\://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
authnContextClassRef=urn\:oasis\:names\:tc\:SAML\:2.0\:ac\:classes\:X509
includeSigningCertificateInSAMLAssertion=false
tokenServiceUser=ZS4H_DMC_COMM
tokenServiceURL=https\://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/bc/sec/oauth2/token
skipUserUuidInSAMLAttributes=false
URL=https\://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/opu/odata4/sap/zapi_productionorder_labels/srvd_a2x/sap/zser_mfg_label/0001
Name=S4-Dev-Label-api-pp
tokenServicePassword=<removed>
Type=HTTP
clientKey=ZS4H_DMC_COMM
Authentication=OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion
nameIdFormat=urn\:oasis\:names\:tc\:SAML\:1.1\:nameid-format\:emailAddress
skipUserAttributesPrefixInSAMLAttributes=false
ProxyType=Internet
userIdSource=
SAMLAssertionProvider=DestinationServiceGenerated

I have created the communication arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud:

 

But when I test the production process which uses the service thus created is not working, i.e., failing with HTTP 401

The production process worked successfully when I had used basic authentication at the BTP destination.

So, does SAP DM support such principal propagation with destination using OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion? Or where am I going wrong?

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: SAP RAP Application – Data Not Inserting into Custom Tables (First RAP Project)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am currently working on my first SAP RAP application in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I need guidance from experienced RAP developers.

Business Requirement

Create an Excel uploader to update Bank Details for Vendor/Customer master data.

What I Have Implemented So Far

I followed the standard RAP development steps:

  1. Created Custom Persistent Tables and Draft Tables

  2. Created Interface CDS View

  3. Created Consumption CDS View

  4. Added Metadata Extensions for UI

  5. Defined Behavior Definitions for Interface and Consumption Views

  6. Implemented Behavior Handler Classes

  7. Created Service Definition

  8. Created Service Binding

Current Issue

  • I am successfully reading Excel data and storing it into an internal table in the behavior implementation class.

  • However, when I try to insert this data into my custom item table, no data is getting persisted in the database.

  • There are no syntax errors, but the records are not saved.

My Doubt / Confusion

Since this is my first RAP project, I am not sure:

  • Whether I am inserting data in the correct RAP lifecycle method

  • If I should use MODIFY ENTITIES instead of direct INSERT

  • If the issue is related to managed behavior, draft handling, or association (_item) handling

  • Or if my behavior definition and class implementation are not aligned

Request for Help

I would really appreciate if someone could:

  • Review my approach

  • Point out what I might be doing wrong

  • Explain the correct way to persist item data in a RAP-managed scenario

  • Share best practices for Excel upload + RAP persistence

I will paste all relevant code (CDS, Behavior Definition, and Class Implementation) below for reference.

Thank you very much in advance for your support.

Please paste your Code recommendation if possible.

Environment:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Extensibility 
RAP (Managed with Draft)

entry.title: S4HC Public Crosscompany Flow CO Issue (Margin analysis by customer not available at group level)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are implementing S4HC Public to a Industrial Food company. They have a manufacturing company (2000) and a trading company (3000). They have a crosscompany process, in which the shipment is done from 2000 and the billing from 3000, so there is an internal billing with a margin because of legal transfer price requirements. Once the flow is done and the accounting documents are registered, the analytical PL by company code is shown in the screenshot attached. 

The problem we find is that the customer filled in the PSG of the expense registered in 3000 (internal billing) is the final customer instead of the group customer (3000), whereas the COGS from the shipment from 2000 has the group customer (3000) instead of the final customer. This standard behaviour of the system prevents the client to analyze the actual margin by customer at group level skipping the internal billing, since the revenue is allocated to the final customer in the PSG, but the COGS from the shipment is allocated to the group customer (3000).

- Implementing transfer pricing is not an option.

- Changing the invoice type from INVOICE02 to INVOICE01 in the IDOC, so that internal billing expense is allocated to the group customer (3000) in the PSG is not allowed in S4HC Public.

- PSG derivation customizing point (which would resolve our problem, since we could change the customer in the PSG according to many conditions and rules) is not available in S4HC Public. Instead we have a very limited app (Manage Substitution and Validation Rules) in which, for the Margin Analysis context, we only have available PSG characteristics as conditions (which are not useful for this case) and fields like gl account or movement type (needed for doing the derivation correctly) are not available.

WHAT CAN WE DO? Is there any custom logic we can use for an "advanced PSG characteristic sustitution"? 

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: S4HC Public Crosscompany CO Issue (Margin Analysis by customer at group level not allowed)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are implementing S4HC Public to a Industrial Food company. They have a manufacturing company (2000) and a trading company (3000). They have a crosscompany process, in which the shipment is done from 2000 and the billing from 3000, so there is an internal billing with a margin because of legal transfer price requirements. Once the flow is done and the accounting documents are registered, the analytical PL by company code is shown in the screenshot attached. 

The problem we find is that the customer filled in the PSG of the expense registered in 3000 (internal billing) is the final customer instead of the group customer (3000), whereas the COGS from the shipment from 2000 has the group customer (3000) instead of the final customer. This standard behaviour of the system prevents the client to analyze the actual margin by customer at group level skipping the internal billing, since the revenue is allocated to the final customer in the PSG, but the COGS from the shipment is allocated to the group customer (3000).

- Implementing transfer pricing is not an option.

- Changing the invoice type from INVOICE02 to INVOICE01 in the IDOC, so that internal billing expense is allocated to the group customer (3000) in the PSG is not allowed in S4HC Public.

- PSG derivation customizing point (which would resolve our problem, since we could change the customer in the PSG according to many conditions and rules) is not available in S4HC Public. Instead we have a very limited app (Manage Substitution and Validation Rules) in which, for the Margin Analysis context, we only have available PSG characteristics as conditions (which are not useful for this case) and fields like gl account or movement type (needed for doing the derivation correctly) are not available.

WHAT CAN WE DO? Is there any custom logic we can use for an "advanced PSG characteristic sustitution"? 

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: Sales Price Rounding Issue S4 HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have a customer requirement Regard to rounding off Price in S4 HANA Public cloud as given below:

Product Selling Price = Base Price * Margin

Base Price (ZPR0) at Material level = Rs. 9.94/KG

Selling Margin at Product Group Level (ZPRM) = 5%

As per Standard Calculation:

Consider order Quantity = 3500

Condition Value (ZPR0) = 3500*9.94 = Rs. 34,790.00

Condition Value (ZPRM) = 34790*0.05 = 1739.50

Gross Condition Value = 34790+1739.50 = 36529.50

Gross Condition Amount = 36529.50/3500 = 10.437 = 10.44 (Round off 2 decimal)

Business Requirement:

Gross Condition Amount = 9.94+(9.94*5%) = 10.44 (Round off 2 decimal)

Gross Condition Value = 10.44 * 3500 = Rs. 36,540

We have achieved business requirement using pricing routine (Extension Point: PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT) for the Gross amount to override the standard calculation. But subsequent calculation for additional conditions, Tax calculation and Final Net Value it is still considering the Gross Amount from standard calculation. Any suggestion to address this?

entry.title: Stock Transfer Order between plants in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – Confirmation control Key
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am configuring a stock transfer order between plants in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Both plants are WM-managed warehouses, and the process requires moving Handling Unit (HU) numbers from one warehouse to another.

While reviewing the Implementation Activities, I cannot find any configuration point where it is possible to define a confirmation control key per document type, similar to what exists in on-premise systems under Define Order Confirmation for Delivery.

In the Plant related Business Partner settings , I have maintained the confirmation key as Inbound Delivery (0004). However, when creating a stock transfer order in ME21N with document type UB, the confirmation field is still empty.

Does anyone know:

  • Where this can be configured in Public Cloud?

  • Or if it is even possible to default the confirmation control key to Inbound Delivery for stock transfer orders?

Any guidance or confirmation of limitations in Public Cloud would be appreciated. I've checked sap note 2436023, and it not apply to Public.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: F4 Value Help for Step Condition in Flexible Workflow – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Public Edition) and trying to add F4 / Value Help for a custom parameter (Purchase Group) in a Flexible Workflow step condition.

Requirement

  • Add a custom step condition in Flexible Workflow

  • Enable F4 value help for the condition parameter

  • Values should come from a custom source (CDS / OData)

What I Have Tried So Far

  1. Implemented the Flexible Workflow BAdI

    • IF_SWF_FLEX_IFS_CONDITION_DEF

    • Defined custom condition and parameter successfully

    • The condition appears correctly in the workflow configuration

  2. Tried using a Custom CDS View (Value Help type)

    • Created CDS view with required fields

    • Enabled it as a Value Help

    • CDS activates successfully

  3. Attempted to connect CDS via OData

    • Created OData service for the CDS

    • Tried to consume this OData in the BAdI for value help

❗ Issue:
At the final step, when trying to use the OData service inside the BAdI, the OData is not working / not accessible in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Because of this:

  • F4 help is not appearing in the workflow step condition

  • I am unable to bind CDS/OData as a value help source

My Questions

  1. Is it technically supported to provide F4 value help for Flexible Workflow step conditions in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?

  2. Is there any approved way to consume CDS or OData for value help in this scenario?

  3. If this is a known limitation, is there any recommended workaround?

Any guidance or confirmation would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

Best Regards,
Jeet Kanabar

entry.title: Tax Card data for Qatar region
entry.content:
Dear experts,

When I try to create Supplier with Country/Region Outside Qatar, the system asks to Maintain the Tax Card data, so i should maintain the Tax card details as Resident or Non - Resident, when i maintain as Non - resident system asks to enter the Withholding tax details for the Supplier, but when i maintain as Resident system allows to Save the Supplier. But to my understanding Supplier outside the Qatar should maintained as Non - Resident. In this case can anyone guide me how to resolve this or there any option to remove the Validation that's asking for tax card details for the Supplier master which is maintained the Country of origin outside Qatar. 

Best regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: Luxembourg eCDF - Generate Financial Statement (RPFILU_AFS)
entry.content:
Hello, 

when I generate eCDF XML file in the Generate Financial Statement - Luxembourg (RPFILU_AFS), the values for <Agent> and <Declarer> section are the default ones provided by SAP. 

How can they be changed? Please note that I did the configuration in the SSCUI 101071 Setting Up Your Statutory Reporting in CBC where I defined the LU_EVATECDF_DECL_... and LU_EVATECDF_SEND_... attributes. But unfortunately it only displays in VAT reports via Run statutory Reports app, but not in RPFILU_AFS. 

Where can I maintain the Electronic Financial Data Collection Platform parameters? 

Many thanks
